page.title: 17HOLIDAY CAMP FIRE AT WOOTTON
page.content: In April, 1985{a fire}devastated the heart of the disused{Warner's {Woodside Holiday Camp}in Wootton on the Isle of Wight.It caused an estimated million pounds worth of damage.It took the local Fire Brigade eleven hours to put the blaze out.They used water from the camp swimming pool to help put out the blaze.All that remained after the fire was the frame of the two storey entertainment complex and nearly all of the camp equipment was destroyed. The camp itself had been closed for the past two seasons, being used as a convenient storing place for materials from four other Warner's holiday camps on the island. It is thought that the fire was started by two very young boys playing with matches in the camp.
